intro: Brachyotum multinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined brachyotum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a prominent venation pattern. Brachyotum multinervium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
